questions.question: 1. What would be the best title for the story?

choices.answer: Joe Joins the Team
Bill Wins the Big Game
Practice Makes Perfect
Bill's Basketball Problem

questions.question: 2. In line 8, the word performed is closest in meaning to _______.

choices.answer: acted
moved
played
changed
He plays better in practice than he does during games.
Joe watches him too closely when he plays.
The school yard is not a good place to practice.
His team loses too many games.

questions.question: 4. Why does Bill play well when Joe is watching him?

choices.answer: He is comfortable with Joe.
He does not know that Joe is there
Joe tells him how to play better.
He wants to prove to Joe that he is a good player.

questions.question: 5. Why does Joe decide to gather a group of people?

choices.answer: Because he wants more players for his team
Because he wants to show them his talent
Because he wants to help Bill feel less nervous
Because he wants more people to see the next game

questions.question: 6. At the end of the story, all of the following people watch Bill practice EXCEPT _______.

choices.answer: Joe
a math teacher
a janitor
the basketball coach

questions.question: 7. Why does the group have to be quiet when they go to the basketball court?

choices.answer: Because Joe is telling Bill what to do
Because Bill likes to practice alone
Because they do not want Bill to know they were there
Because the group needs to listen to Joeâ€™s instructions
